required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ultrasonography SWE for Hepatic Fibrosis Evaluation
clinical_study.official_title: Diagnostic Performance of Shear Wave Elastography for Fibrosis Evaluation: Preliminary Study

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to measure diagnostic performance of ultrasound shear wave elastography to detect advanced hepatic fibrosis.

detailed_description.textblock:
Hepatic fibrosis causes liver dysfunction and HCC. Since hepatic fibrosis is reversible dynamic condition, its monitoring is important to predict long term outcome and to determine treatment plan.
The reference of standard to diagnose hepatic fibrosis is biopsy, but recently non-invasive method such as stiffness imaging has been drawing a lot of attention. In this study, ultrasound shear wave elastography will be performed and its diagnostic performance to detect advanced hepatic fibrosis (= > F2) will be measured using histologic grade as a reference.

primary_outcome.measure: diagnostic performance to detect advanced hepatic fibrosis
primary_outcome.description: from ultrasound SWE to perform hepatic resection or percutaneous liver biopsy in patients (with histologic diagnosis)

secondary_outcome.description: two observers perform ultrasound SWE on the same day in volunteers.
interval between US and MR elastography in patients with available MR elastography
technical success or failure of US elastography using GE LOGIQ E9 scanner in ALL study population
reliable measurement rate (interquartile range of serial measurement/median LS value <30%) in patients with technically successful US elastography

intervention.description: ultrasound shear wave elastography is performed in GE ultrasound scanner according to guidelines of ultrasound elastography.

study_pop.textblock: Patients who are scheduled to undergo liver resection or liver biopsy (n=138). Volunteers who agree to undergo US shear wave elastography (n=20) to determine inter-observer agreement.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- volunteers who agree to undergo US shear elastography OR
- patients with chronic liver disease who are scheduled to undergo liver resection or liver parenchymal biopsy.
AND
- = or > 18 years
- sign informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- none
